case_vignette: A 65-year-old man presents to the emergency department with back pain. The patient states that he has gradually worsening back pain that seems to have worsened after moving furniture the other day. He also states that while he walks, he feels numbness and weakness in his legs. The only time the patient states his back pain is improved is when he is riding his bike or pushing a cart at the grocery store. The patient has a past medical history of osteoporosis, dyslipidemia, and diabetes. He drinks 3 alcoholic drinks every day and has a 44 pack-year smoking history. His temperature is 99.5°F (37.5°C), blood pressure is 157/108 mmHg, pulse is 90/min, respirations are 17/min, and oxygen saturation is 98% on room air. Physical exam is notable for a non-tender spine with normal mobility in all 4 directions. Radiography of the spine and basic labs are ordered.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Neurology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have gradually worsening back pain that got worse after I moved furniture, and I feel numbness and weakness in my legs when I walk.
How old are you and what is your sex?
I am a 65-year-old man.
Have you had any recent injuries or accidents involving your back?
The back pain seemed to have worsened after moving furniture the other day.
Do you have any history of back problems or surgeries?
No, I haven't mentioned having any back problems or surgeries before.
Are you experiencing any problems with bowel or bladder control?
I haven't mentioned any issues with bowel or bladder control.
Have you noticed any changes in your reflexes or does the numbness in your legs affect one side more than the other?
I haven't mentioned any changes in my reflexes, and I haven't specified if the numbness affects one side more than the other.
Do you have any other medical conditions or are you currently on any medication?
I have osteoporosis, dyslipidemia, and diabetes.
Does your family have a history of neurological conditions or spinal issues?
I haven't mentioned anything about my family's medical history.
Is the pain localized in one area of your back or does it radiate down your legs?
The pain is in my back and I feel numbness and weakness in my legs when I walk, but I haven't mentioned pain radiating down my legs.
**Final Diagnosis:** Lumbar spinal stenosis secondary to osteoporosis and exacerbated by physical exertion.
